channel.title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows [Part 2]
channel.description:
Who is going to see it? The trailer special effects look amazing.
I'm seeing it in about 12 or 13 hours from now, will post review when I do.
PS - http://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/harry_potter_and_the_deathly_hallows_part_2/ Highest rating I've seen for any film on there

[quote=“TabbyKiller, post:29, topic:404273”]Ever since I was a little boy my father and I would see the episodes together. Still haven’t seen part 1 with him so I better download it soon[/quote]I actually did the same with my dad and we went to see the last one together as well.

item.title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows [Part 2]
item.dc:creator: @Unlimited1 .Unlimited
item.description:
@Unlimited1 wrote:

The movie was great but as said the book was better. Being the shortest movie in the series one would think they would be able to add a lot more scenes and make it more like the book.

Read full topic
item.source: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows [Part 2]

item.title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows [Part 2]
item.dc:creator: @Eh_Pretty_Easy Eh Pretty Easy
item.description:
@Eh_Pretty_Easy wrote:

The movie was great, but definitely not on par with the book. I got to see it on the 13th because Finnish people are pro. The only disappointment for me was the fact that so many scenes originally in the book were not shown in the movie, such as Harry telling everyone about Snape’s true past in the central hall etc.

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“Mopman, post:21, topic:404273”]pratchett wrote plenty of (very good) non adult oriented discworld books.

the wee free men trilogy being the main example

edit: theres four… wtf is that called. quadrilogy? :p[/quote]In the discworld series there’s a total of 5 YA books. 5 out of 39 books isn’t really much

item.title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows [Part 2]
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:19, topic:404273”]no i love pratchett, i just find it weird to use the worlds most famous comedy fantasy writer as an example of “serious”[/quote]How can you not have picked up all the references to our own society in the books?

Anyways, i used the wrong word in the post. I meant more adult-oriented rather than serious. And yes, Eddings isn’t particularily adult oriented at all, but compared to Harry Potter it is lightyears ahead

Read full topic

item.title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows [Part 2]
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Just got back from seeing it, IMAX 3D was pretty awesome, special effects in general were epic too. Just like I felt with the last book, I felt there was more that she/they could tell us, but I’ll live with what I get.

Sad that it’s all over of course, but a great movie all the same.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:11, topic:404273”]terry pratchett serious???[/quote]The Discworld novels are very serious, there’s just a fuckton of satire that reflects on our society. I guess that’s part of why i like it.

item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

item.title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows [Part 2]
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:7, topic:404273”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=501322.msg3668128#msg3668128 date=1310745146]
A week or so ago I tried to get my mom to read the book but she instead continued reading one of her crappy library books Oh well their loss. Leaving in like 3 hours

[quote author=Speljohan link=topic=501322.msg3667988#msg3667988 date=1310734844]
Havent seen the movie but overall the series are crap.
[/quote]Have you read the books? Opinion on them?
[/quote]Read half the first one, do not like. I prefer fantasy that is less fairy tale and more serious, eg anything by David Eddings, Robert Jordan or Terry Pratchett.[/quote]If the first book is the first one you read, you don’t appreciate the rest of the series. To be honest it’s pretty poorly written, and the series doesn’t even get interesting really until #4. Only upon re-reading the entire thing do you understand why the others are important at all

Read full topic

item.title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows [Part 2]
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Didn’t watch movies as i read the books and movies are very rarely as good as or better than the books.

Having said I also think Harry Potter would be probably be quite boring to me now, although I cannot deny my enjoyment of the books while I was at school!

Read full topic
